text:
The signjar task should support the new timestamping feature of the new
jarsigner in JDK 1.5. In jarsigner, this is specified with -tsa -option.
Please note also proxy options, -J-Dhttp.proxyHost=<host> -J-Dhttp.proxyPort=<port>.
creator: tero.kinnunen@med.ge.com

text:
If you are willing to 
- write the code, code that degrades gracefully on Java<1.5.
- write the tests
- write the docs
-supply the changes as CVS diff -u patches to this bug. 

then we will gladly incorporate the changes. 

Regarding proxy information, you should not extend the ant task. Instead you
should extract the current information from the JVM, as set by the <setproxy>
task, and pass it down. We may still want to make the -J option broadly
accessible, as it does appear in the 1.4 documentation.
creator: stevel@apache.org
kevin.jackson@it.fts-vn.com
text:
Created attachment 13544
Adds TSA funtcionality to SignJar task

Here's a patch that should address the issue.  I've tested the individual
method that I've added (note junit test included).  Unfortunately the actual
signing of the jar fails because of some arcane .keystore issues.

I'd love to track this down and pove to myself that the changes in the patch
work as proposed, unfortunately I've run out of time - got to go teach, so I'm
uploading this as a basis for someone else to take forward (sorry about that).

I think it will work, if you can correctly configure the keystore etc.	See
code for additional info.

Kev
*** Bug 33732 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
creator: stevel@apache.org

text:
There is a (different) implementation in CVS_HEAD. I skipped on the java version
stuff for now, though do use the JavaEnvUtils checks at test time.

We need a way of testing this, opentsa.org may be a possibility, if we can get
the cert into our test keystore. 

Marking as closed, though about to open one for proxies
creator: stevel@apache.org
